resources.string: Add a new musical fragment to start tracking your practice
Fragment type is a required field
Practice time is a required field
Practice date is a required field
Add A Music Fragment To Practice
I played always the correct notes. No mistakes
I played most of the times the correct notes. Very rarely I played a wrong note
I played the whole fragment with some recurring wrong notes
I played partially the fragment due to some wrong notes
I could not play the whole fragment. I haven\'t memorized it or cannot read it from the score
I played accurately all the rhythmic figures. I also have control to play behind and above the beat
I played accurately most of the rhythmic figures. There are only some small details to improve
I played partially the fragment. There are some rhythmic figures I cannot execute
I could not play most of the fragment\'s rhythmic figures.
I do not understand the rhythmic figures of this fragment
I performed all the music articulations with a clear and distinct sound
I performed most of the music articulations with a clear and distinct sound
I performed some of the music articulations with a clear and distinct sound
I performed a few music articulations with a clear and distinct sound
This fragment has music articulations but I performed none of them
Fragment\'s dynamics are totally distinguishable on the interpretation
Fragment\'s dynamics are clear but I feel there\'s room for improvement
The intention of the dynamics is audible but is not very clear
Performance dynamics is partially aligned with the fragment\'s dynamics
Performance dynamics are completely not aligned with fragment\'s dynamics
I performed effortlessly. I can focus my attention in other things and play with no mistakes
I performed with no tension but from time to time I have to focus on my performances otherwise I could make mistakes
I did not feel tension in my body, however I have to put all my attention in my performance
I felt tension in my body, but no pain
I felt tension in my body, some parts of my body even hurt
Did you played the correct notes? Did the notes sounded clear?
Did the music articulations sounded clean?
In your performance the intended dynamics are clear?
Write any other relevant aspect about your performance (optional).
